FacilityName: Van de Water, Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for the Erie County Water Authority Sturgeon Point and Van de Water-Water Treatment Plants.   



Accident Release Prevention Policy: The Authority will take every reasonable action to prevent all accidental releases. This is accomplished by using the most current design, training, and inspecting processes available. The Authority's prevented maintenance program includes

1)    Having an analysis of the scrubber media tested twice per year, to verify the scrubber chlorine neutralization capacity.

2)     The Halogen eclipse automatic shutoff valves are factory tested yearly 

3)     Gas detectors are tested weekly. 

4)    Chlorine flexible lines and Header valves from the tank to the manifold are replaced yearly.



Operating and maintenance procedures are reviewed annually and are officially approved as the accepted operating procedures. 

Personnel are trained on operation and maintenance procedures annually. 

The Stationary Source for Chlorine (CAS No. 7782-50-5) remains the same as the RMP 1999



Sturgeon Point

The Worst-case Scenario was completed for 2011 the population radius of 3.0 miles is based on a rural area. The Alternative Release Scenario was completed for 2011 the population radius of 1.2 miles is based on a rural area.  



Van de Water

The Worst-case Scenario was completed for 2011 the population radius of 1.3 miles is based on an urban area. The Alternative Release Scenario was completed for 2011 the population radius of 0.5 miles is based on an urban area.  

Population was based on using the Marplot program. 



Accidental Release Prevention Program remains the same as the RMP 2007



Emergency Response Program (ERP) revised 'April 2010. The ERP is in the progress of being scheduled and coordinated with the District One Response. 



Sturgeon Point

The contact is the Local Fire Department Fire Chief of the Highland Hose Volunteer Fire Company. 

Van de Water 

The contact is the Local Fire Department Fire Chief of the Brighton Volunt

eer Fire Company.



Planned changes to improve Safety, none outstanding.

The Halogen eclipse yoke assembles were upgrade in 2009, to reduce the potential chlorine release when connecting chlorine cylinders.

Emergency Contact is 11 trained Hazwoper Site Coordinators to assist Hazmat personnel when responding to a release. 

In 2009 personnel are equipped with full face mask which are interchangeable as an escape mask or positive displacement mask.
